verbose_text: Since E F, Pd < E F, MoS 2 < E F, Au, charge transfer occurs at the interfaces, causing doping of the MoS 2 channel and accumulation of space charge in the contact region, yielding Schottky barriers and either upward (hole doping) or downward (electron doping) bending of the conduction and valence band edges.
evidence: Pd  < E F, MoS 2  < E F,  Au , charge transfer occurs at the interfaces, causing doping of the MoS
